channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Marketers Can Turn Unpredictability Into Influence
item.description: In a volatile market, the brands that win now don’t just sell. Their superpower is the ability to soothe.

item.title: Gap says Trump’s tariffs could cost the company a whopping $300 million, sending shares into a tailspin
item.description: The company behind Banana Republic and Old Navy fell 19% after saying tariffs on imports could add up to $300 million in costs.

item.title: The ‘Masculine Energy’ Needed in the Workplace Isn’t What You Think
item.description: Many young men are in crisis not because they lack masculinity, but because they’ve inherited only its shadow.

item.title: Content Creators Shouldn’t Start Their Own Companies. They Should Do This Instead
item.description: Underscore Talent’s Reza Izad says nearly 90 percent of his clients are “probably better served in the license capacity.”

item.title: Mondelez is suing Aldi, alleging the supermarket chain ‘blatantly copies’ its packaging. The side-by-side photos are wild
item.description: Mondelez said Aldi’s packaging was "likely to deceive and confuse customers."

item.title: Bluesky is most definitely alive and kicking

item.title: The 13-year-old who won the Scripps National Spelling Bee almost choked at the end because he got too cocky: ‘I think he cared too much about his aura’
item.description: Faizan Zaki was two words away from victory, but let his showman instincts take over.

item.title: Barack Obama says work-life balance isn’t real for successful people
item.description: Even former President Obama admits: you can’t have it all—at least not at once.

item.title: 3 Questions the Best Leaders Ask to Weather Big Storms

item.title: Bill Ackman is keen on Trump privatizing Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. There’s a right way and a wrong way to do it
item.description: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac should compete and survive on the same terms as other regulated financial firms.
